thanksForShare.headline.under50percent: Your Salary is at the bottom of the scale, do you deserve a pay raise?
thanksForShare.headline.under70percent: Your Salary is in the middle of the scale, would you consider better paid jobs?
thanksForShare.headline.under100percent: Congratulations, your Salary is at the top of the scale, is time for getting a promotion?
thanksForShare.item1.headline: 1 - Read Your Salary Report
thanksForShare.item1.content: This Salary Survey help you compare with people who do the same job at a similar company, have similar experience and live where you do. In general if your earnings fall below the 50% you probably want to start thinking about asking for a raise or looking for a new job.
thanksForShare.item2.headline: 2 - Strategize
thanksForShare.item2.content: Salary negotiation is always challenging, keep it professional, friendly, data driven and timely. Leverage your skills and experience to justify your salary raise request.
thanksForShare.item3.headline: 3 - Negotiate
thanksForShare.item3.content: Be ambitious but realistic, salary increases vary depends on industry but average stands between 2% to 5%, while a promotion or a new job might get you a salary increase between 10% to 20%.
